meanings.definition: The quality of being relevant or applicable to a particular matter or situation.
meanings.sent1: The pertinency of the evidence in the court case was crucial for the verdict.
meanings.sent2: Her argument lacked pertinency to the topic of discussion.
meanings.sent3: The pertinency of the joke at that moment made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The pertinency of his advice was like a guiding light in the darkness of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The pertinency of the map saved them from getting lost in the forest.

meanings.definition: The state of being pertinent or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: The pertinency of his outfit for the formal event was evident.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the pertinency of his remarks during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The pertinency of the cat wearing a hat was quite amusing at the party.
meanings.sent4: The pertinency of her smile lit up the room like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The pertinency of his actions spoke louder than words in that situation.
